fill_infos: Please fill in the information to be able to auction your asset
title: Title*
first_term: 1. To participate in the auction for granting government commercial, residential, commercial and industrial lands and investment landsusing the usufruct right system through public auction, the followingare required:
second_term: To be an Omani natural person, or a company (legal person), in which the Omani or GCC nationals’ contribution is not less than (30%).
third_term: Registration through the electronic system using the ID number or the commercial register, with the need to ensure that the conditions for entering the auction are met.
fourth_term: Bidding shall be on each site individually electronically.
fifth_term: The value of participation in the auction is (500) five hundred Omani riyals that are refundable for those who did not win the auction, in addition to (100) one hundred riyals that are non-refundable, and this does not include the registration fees on the electronic platform.
browse_auctions:
With LEILAM, you can now browse through thousands of
auctions to find your next big purchase
condition: To participate in the auction for granting government commercial, residential, commercial and industrial lands and investment lands using the usufruct right system through public auction, the following are required
part_two: Once the auction is closed, the winner (who submitted the highest price) must accept the payment of the usufruct value of the square meter of the land being auctioned according to the price he submitted
part_three: The winner will be contacted with the outcome of the auction by text message to review the ministry within (10) ten working days from the date of the notification to complete the procedures and contract. The award and confiscation of the subscription value
condition4: The first contract is issued for a period of (2) two years, subject to renewal, and is renewed every (5) five years after the completion of implementation, or according to the mortgage period in the case of financing, provided that the total period of the contract does not exceed (99) ninety-nine years
condition5: The beneficiary is obligated to complete the architectural drawings and maps for the final conception of the project in accordance with the engineering, technical and administrative procedures and requirements for the concerned authorities to approve them, issue building permits and the necessary licenses in accordance with the applicable regulations, and pay the prescribed fees for issuing such licenses.
condition6: The beneficiary must start executing the project within a period not exceeding (2) two years from the date of registering the usufruct contract, and the contract is considered void in the event that implementation is not started at the end of that period, and the Ministry has the right to restore the situation to what it was before signing the contract at the expense of the beneficiary
condition7: Responsibility for delivering services to and within the boundaries of the plot, the fees incurred in connection and any other fees, are at the expense of the beneficiary, and he must submit his initial data to the agencies and companies concerned with the delivery of services, in order to determine the available options for delivery in accordance with the laws and regulations in force
condition8: The beneficiary shall be responsible for managing, maintaining and cleaning the project facilities and all its elements that are constructed throughout the period of use, as well as any other responsibilities resulting from his exploitation and use of the site
condition9: Ministry has the right not to assign the auction to any of the applicants after the end of the bidding, if it considers that the offered price is not achieving the desired goal or because the submitted project does not serve the development in the state in which the land was signed or for any other reason
term1: To be an Omani natural person, or a company (legal person), in which the Omani or GCC nationals' contribution is not less than (30%)
term2: Registration through the electronic system using the ID number or the commercial register, with the need to ensure that the conditions for entering the auction are met
term3: Bidding shall be on each site individually electronically
term4: The value of participating in the auction is (500) five hundred Omani riyals, refundable for those who did not win the auction, and this does not include the registration fees on the electronic platform
term5: Inspection of the site is an examination due to ignorance before participating in the bidding, and accordingly the bidder is considered to have fulfilled this condition just for his participation so that he cannot later claim any ignorance regarding the site, and bear the costs incurred in case of preparing or reclaiming the site for the establishment of the project
